DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: Youssef, K.;Youssef K.Y.A;Khamis Youssef;YOUSSEF, KHAMIS;Khamis Y;YOUSSEF;KHAMIS YOUSSEF;Khamis;Khamis, Y.;Khamis Y,;ABD-ELSALAM, K. A.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: I am Dr. Youssef Khamis Youssef Ahmed. I was born in Egypt on 1980, obtained my BSc in 2002 of Agriculture Sciences, Plant Pathology at Faculty of Agriculture, Assiut University, Egypt. In 2005, I got the Diploma of Specialized Postgraduate Studies in ?Integrated Pest Management of Mediterranean Fruit Tree Crops? at CIHEAM-Bari in Italy. In 2007, I obtained my MSc in IPM of Mediterranean Fruit Tree Crops at CIHEAM-MAIB, Italy. In 2011, I got my PhD in Plant Protection Curriculum: Integrated Crop Protection from Bari University Aldo Moro, Italy. I am officially working as a Senior Researcher (associate professor) in Plant Pathology Research Institute, Agricultural Research Center (ARC) in Egypt. During 2012-2013, I had a PostDoc position at Department of Agronomy, Londrina State University in Brazil. I have membership and contributions in several professional societies, Editorial board member and reviewer for several national and international journals. Recently, I am working as a visiting researcher (level 1) at the Department of Agronomy, Londrina State University in Brazil.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Membership and Contributions in Professional Societies: - Member of the American Phytopathological Society (APS), U.S.A (Membership number: 208287). - Member of the Italian Phytopathological Society (Societ Italiana di Patologia Vegetale, S.I.Pa.V.), Italy (Membership receipt number: 20). - Member of Arab Society for Plant Protection (ASPP), Beirut- Lebanon. - Cooperative member with the Chinese Society for Plant Pathology (CSPP) in Beijing, China. - Member of Egyptian Phytopathological Society. - Member of The Egyptian Chemical Society.

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: INPI - Instituto Nacional da Propriedade Industrial
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.NOME-DO-DEPOSITANTE: Youssef Khamis Youssef Ahmed;ROBERTO, SERGIO RUFFO;Universidade Estadual de Londrina

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A presente inveno refere-se um composto e ao processo de produo de nanopartculas de quitosana (CN) e slica (SN) combinadas (CSN), as quais foram caracterizadas, e sua eficincia anti-fngica contra Botrytis cinerea, causador do mofo cinzento, testada in vitro e in vivo em uvas de mesa. Sob condies de infeco natural, em uvas de mesa ?Itlia? e ?Benitaka? (Vitis vinifera L.), os produtos reduziram significativamente a incidncia de mofo cinzento. O CSN 1,0% foi o mais efetivo tratamento, reduzindo o desenvolvimento do mofo cinzento em 59 e 83% (aps 30 dias de armazenamento refrigerado a 1 C) nas uvas ?Itlia? e ?Benitaka?, respectivamente, quando comparado ao controle. O impacto do CSN sobre as propriedades fsico-qumicas das uvas, como slidos solveis, acidez titulvel, ndice de maturao, ndice de cor das uvas, perda de massa e degrana foi avaliado. O efeito do CSN sobre as espcies reativas ao oxignio (ROS), contedo adenosina-fosfato (ATP) e potencial de membrana mitocondrial (MMP) do esporo de B. cinerea foi determinado para verificar seu modo de ao. O efeito de sinergismo do CSN o configura como um alternativo meio de controle do mofo cinzento em uvas de mesa para manter a qualidade ps colheita dos frutos.
